briefTitle: Povidone-iodine Against Sodium Hypochlorite as Skin Antiseptics

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Healthy adult volunteers.

Exclusion Criteria:

* History of skin allergies or atopy, as well as reactions to soaps, iodine, chlorine, or latex

outcomeMeasures.title: Bacterial Count of Skin Cultures for the 10% Povidone-iodine Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Bacterial colony count of skin cultures to determine antiseptic properties

outcomeMeasures.title: Presence of Skin Reactions for the 10% Povidone-iodine Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Presence of allergy or any skin reaction at 24 hours after the antiseptic application

outcomeMeasures.title: Bacterial Colony Forming Units for the 10% Sodium Hypochlorite Period
outcomeMeasures.description: After incubation, the outcome assessor counted the colonies to determine the colony-forming units per square centimeter (CFU/cm2) of skin.

outcomeMeasures.title: Bacterial Colony Forming Units for the Control Period
outcomeMeasures.description: After incubation, the outcome assessor counted the colonies to determine the colony-forming units per square centimeter (CFU/cm2) of skin.

outcomeMeasures.title: Presence af Allergy or Skin Reaction for the 10% Sodium Hypochlorite Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Presence of allergy or skin reaction at 24 hours after the application of the antiseptic
